title: Science says you sleep better if you have a loving partner!
content:
​The science behind your goodnight sleep.

Being in a healthy relationship has several benefits, and one of these is that your snoozing hours are peaceful and uninterrupted every night. According to a study published in the journal of Social Psychological and Personal Science, people tend to sleep better if they feel their partner is responsive to their needs.

subContents.SubTitle: 1. The study
subContents.SubContent: Researchers from the University of Turkey studied around 700 people who were either married or living together. They were asked how responsive their partner was to their needs and how well they slept every night.

subContents.SubTitle: 2. The finding
subContents.SubContent: The findings of the research indicated a correlation between sleep quality and having a loving partner. Participants who felt cared for in their relationship were less likely to get anxious or depressed and in turn, slept well at night.

subContents.SubTitle: 3. The concept of restorative sleep
subContents.SubContent: The research mentioned that a person gets ‘restorative sleep’ (basically good quality and uninterrupted sleep) when he or she feels safe and secure in life.

subContents.SubTitle: 4. The researchers’ logic
subContents.SubContent: As a child, we find this sense of security from our parents and as an adult, we are somehow dependent on our romantic partners for the same. Hence, the more our partner makes us feel safe and protected, the better we sleep at night.

subContents.SubTitle: 5. Another study
subContents.SubContent: Another study done at the University of Pittsburgh has a similar finding. Its states sleeping next to someone you love can reduce your stress levels, and even protect you from digestive problems and heart diseases.

subContents.SubTitle: 6. The benefits
subContents.SubContent: Not just this, happy couples who sleep together tend to have higher levels of oxytocin, the hormone that is associated with bonding and sexual activity.
